column4: I tried switching to Kubuntu, but it seems like Gnome is still running, how can I just get rid of Gnome.
at the Login screen (kdm or gdm) theres a 'session' menu - you select kde or gnome from there.
I did that, and I'm running KDE right now, but I noticed alot of apps still use Gnome settings, and My desktop is gnome
that.. made no sence..  if you are running KDE then how id your desktop gnome?
you dident accidently run Nautilus some how did you?  that can goof things up.
perhaps make a new user and login to kde with them.. see if it uses kde or not.
that could have happened at some point in the past, I Believe that some file associations were broken.
ive seen that kde4 + gnome can cause some... issues if both used...
ah that was it, natalus was running
i recall speciciaally last i tried kde + gnome and xfce that the 'default tool to open special locations' keep getting confused.
gnome started launching the kde file manager,  or the xfce file manager for the gnome places -> whatever locations.
then i fixed that.. kde started runnignthe gnome file manager for their special locations
did they do somthing to improve kde lately?   last i tried it.. i couldent stand to use it. :) which is why im now using gnome.
i am constantly amazed at how all these 'new' innovations in gui 'research' and design.. really dont make things any easier.... :)
not at this time as far as i know of.
